availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James L. Henderson (Ballard County, Kentucky, master carpenter)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, master carpenter. Tennessee native. Married to Phoebe Henderson. Father of Frances A. Henderson, Sarah J. Henderson, Nancy E. Henderson, John W. Henderson, William H. Henderson, James H. Henderson, Matilda Henderson, and Alice Henderson. Master carpenter in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed John H. Gambill and Elisha Bristow as farm hands in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, pp. 601-602.
